hair.

text: Ah, Poland. So far from God, so close to Prussia.

name: i_love_kate
text: My history's pretty hazy, but I'm relatively sure that Prussia didn't even exist a full calendar year ago.

name: srikamaraja
text: Oh, it's still there. Russia bought the place out with some leftover mortars, and re-named it Kaliningrad.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: It was such a good deal from Publishers Clearing House .

name: davidadam
text: I must be from the wrong part of the country as I have either never heard a polack joke or have heard so few that I forget them. I hereby challenge the people after me to fill up this page with said jokes for my benefit.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
Q: How do you sink a Polish battleship?

A: Put it in the water.

[PAUSE FOR L@FFS]

more equally compelling Polish humor at http://www.lysator.liu.se/jokes/polish.html

name: mugi
text: That is truly the limit.

name: mulisha7
text:
What do you get when you cross a gorilla and a polack?

A retarded gorilla.

name: ford
text: A Frenchman, an Italian and a Polack are discussing the purpose of the head at the end of the penis.  The Frenchman says, "It exists to give the woman a more pleasurable experience."  The Italian says "You are incorrect, it exists to enhance the man's pleasure."  The Polack says, "You are both wrong, it is there to keep your hand from slipping off."

name: garlic_breath
text:
The only one I can remember now is the Polack that is in a bar and the bartender offers to tell him a Polack joke. The guy gets all mad and says, "I'll have you know that I'm Polish," and the bartender says, "That's okay, I'll tell it slow."

I remember hearing more when I was a little kid but I think they were all like dumb little kid jokes, like "Why did the Polack throw the clock out of the window? Because he wanted to see time fly." Stuff like that. They were all about how Polish people are stupid. I don't really understand were it comes from.
The last panel in this strip made me laugh really hard.

name: epicurus
text: I love what Ray thinks is an acceptable joke about a Japanese person. It coincides with my own fantasy version of Japan (I hope it is fantasy, anyway).

name: aaron_haynes
text: I like how he doesn't throw the magazine. He just unceremoniously lets it drop. Dear lord spare me those awful Polack jokes.

name: ssddr
text: I would like to see the haircut so boring that it causes its owner to become deceased.

name: soticoto
text:
It is the German response to the fatal joke.
Probably also why Pat hates barbers.

text: A comment left by soylimpio was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by VandenBos, pwb, twohundredninety, goocifer, Towel)

name: connellingus
text: Ray said Ray thought it was an acceptable joke.

name: jackparsons
text:
Culturalist is not racist, even if the Japanese are insist on conflating the two.

The Japanese joke is funny, and even funnier when there are thousands of penis tentacles raping everyone at the city council meeting. Urotskokodoji!

name: deusoma
text: The fact that I already knew what Urotskokodoji was makes me very sad inside. Have a chubby for making me care.

name: farqussus
text: It's Urotsukidoji, and I'm very ashamed.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
A roommate in college made some friends and I watch this. It was funny at first, and then just tiresome after a while.

Always makes for a good reference, though.

name: dartigen
text:
It is apparently some sort of metaphorical story about the dangers of AIDS.
(Yeah I don't get it either. I thought it was just porn.)

name: kunkler
text: I don't know why but the joke about the German made me laugh for ten minutes straight.  Gotta love ripping on germans.

name: honesttom
text: The final panel feels kinda old-skool humour. Not in a bad way.

name: jackparsons
text: Took me a few readings to get RB saying 'vestigial' instead of 'anachronistic'.

name: tangram
text: There's a fairly dirty song about Polish women in Vonnegut's "Slaughterhouse-Five."  Chances are most of us have read it...

name: cameasiam
text: It is really dark in my room and I went to toss a cigarette butt out the window and it bounced of my cat who I could not see. This has nothing to do with this strip.

name: hateandwar
text: dude what the hell

name: nigelchaos
text: I'm glad you clarified it had nothing to do with the strip. Otherwise, I would've thought it did. Still Chubby though!

text: Okay

text: 5 for the last panel. It made me dork-laugh.

name: soticoto
text:
Poles are funny?

I thought all they did was opened Kebab shops and stole roofing jobs...

name: farqussus
text: They also have names with thirteen letters, but only one of which is a vowel.

name: pogo
text: You're thinking of Serbians.

name: farqussus
text: Arek Przybylski would be insulted!

name: utv
text:
Polish suddenly becomes very easy to pronounce once you recognize that most of those commonly occurring 2- or 3-consonant clusters are simple phonemes(?) - that is, don't go trying to pronounce each individual letter. For example, the aforementioned "rz" makes sort of a z or a j sound... kinda like the French word "je." Furthermore, the y's are always pronounced as short i's are in English (as in fish, wit, lip). Add that to the fact that unlike English, the vowels are always pronounced the same way, and stress nearly always falls on the second-to-last syllable, and Polish is a fairly sensible and consistent language to pronounce.

Arek "Pje-bill-ski"

name: farqussus
text: The more I know

name: relaxing
text:
What country are you from, that the Poles are roofers?
(In the United States it is the Mexicans who are roofers.)

name: cracklewater
text:
Poles reportedly did all building work in the UK between about 2002 and 2008.

Then a large proportion saw the writing on the wall and went back home before the UK economy crashed, cashing in their sterling for zloty while the exchange was still good.

That's what I call smart!

name: farqussus
text: and before all the aforementioned houses fell down

name: greenkoolayd
text: sounds like gypsies to me....

name: soticoto
text: You're not wrong.

name: agentstinky
text: Hey-ooo!  Ha ha ha!  You are correct sir!

name: dusty
text:
"I don't really understand were it comes from."
I believe it originated in the 40's when the polish rode horses into several battles in world war 2. In many cases against armored/tank divisions. But that was kind of like a roast beef thing is a fact, but sad, and which sucks to say.

Anyway, that could explain all the war related ones, like this
What do you do if a Polak throws a hand-grenade at you?
Take the pin out and throw it back.

name: achilleselbow
text: You're half right, in the sense that this is when the jokes began to be commonly identified with Polish people, but all of the basic jokes were derived from a common Eastern European stock where each population would make fun of neighboring ones. I'm Russian and a lot of jokes that we have about the Chucki are the same as Polish jokes.

name: pogo
text:
You're right that many xenophobic cultural groups tell these "stupid" jokes about their neighbors. It reveals a weakness in all of us to be "better" than others, knowing we are just the same if not stupider in reality.

My favorite theory about why the Poles got so lambasted with these shitty jokes has to do with the number of concentration camps that were set up in Poland, and the huge number of Polish Jews that were killed, thus angering the next generation of Jewish joke writers who manufactured millions of these jokes in revenge.

name: wartooth
text: UZBEKS...

name: shutup_shutup
text: ...Aren't Eastern European, but Central Asian.

name: kickstart
text: Yay, CatBank!

name: dusty
text: yeah, that Hobbes picture was just temporary until I could get my actual portrait up.

name: tbtabby
text: I heard that it started in World War I, when Polish refugees came to the US. Most of the refugees were from rural Poland, so they didn't have access to a higher education.

name: puguglypress
text: I heard it's cuz they're STUPID!

name: drago25
text: I've always been totally down with Polack jokes.

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, Rhadamanthus, Lumus)

name: dusty
text: this really plucks your whiskers doesn't it? Though I can see how it's a short step from laughing at jokes about different nationalities to mass murder.

name: pogo
text: Yes, I admit to a certain sensitivity, especially when you consider how many millions of Poles and other Slavs were also killed by the Nazis.

name: dusty
text: Ok, your talking about the holocaust again, which would make sense if that was what the joke was about. Its like if i said, "I dont like rice crispies" and you said it bugged you cause we once fire bombed japan and it makes you sensitive.

name: pogo
text: I must be a dumb Polock, I guess.

text:
How do you get a one-armed Carthaginian out of a tree?

Wave to him!

Oh, is it too soon? Sorry.

name: 7th_shot
text: I've been in RB's shoes before in panel 4. Just that token noise, one step up from "uh-huh", so your rambling friend doesn't think they're being ignored.

name: gmm
text: We all come to regret subscribing to racist humour magazines eventually

name: charchar
text: I love that Ray once subscribed to a magazine about Polak jokes and still read it, so surprised and incensed.

name: rykan
text:
I have a couple of Polish customers in my booze shop. One of them is like this. The other is farking HUGE and laughs at everything.
Still a win on this, though.

name: tommythebrat
text:
How many poles does it take to screw in a light bulb?

Two or more! One to screw it in and the others to act in a stereotypical manner that puts their whole nation to shame!

text: Now that's funny!

text:
What do you call a pole flying a plane?
A pilot you racist.

what do you get when you mix a Polish kid and a Mexican kid..?

someone who spray paints his name on chain link fences.

name: goatmasterflash
text: I was flying on LOT (Poland's main airline) 15 years ago, and the entire left side of the plane was designated non-smoking seats, while the entire right side of the plane was the smoking section. No joke (and no air-curtain).

name: hendetta
text:
This makes two strips in a row that deal with Ray's taste in strange magazines.

I imagine that he is subscribed to every magazine in the world that somewhat catches his interest.

text: Ray's stomach looks like a face in the last panel. It appears to be trying to finish reading a joke before the magazine falls out of sigh.

text:

Why don't bass players tell blonde jokes?
They don't understand them.
